intro: Niphobolus laevis, commonly known as the smooth niphobolus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in dry, rocky environments. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Niphobolus laevis is often found in coastal and inland areas with well-drained soils.
